net.ralphpina.permissionsmanager

Class PermissionsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.ralphpina.permissionsmanager.PermissionsManager

  • public class PermissionsManager
extends Object
    PermissionsManager is the point of entry to finding about and requesting permissions. This class helper methods for the following permissions:
    • Camera
    • Location
    • Audio Recording
    • Calendar
    • Contacts
    • Storage
    • Phone Call
    All other permissions can be requested. But it requires more management from the developer. However they can easily be added in the future. The method intentToAppSettings(Activity) can be used to open the app's settings to turn on a permission if the user checked "Never ask again".

    • Field Detail

      • REQUEST_CAMERA_PERMISSION

        public static final int REQUEST_CAMERA_PERMISSION
        Request code to use in your Activity.onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[]) or Fragment.onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[]) to check camera permission was granted. You can also easily check in the Activity.onResume() or Fragment.onResume()
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Returns:

      • neverAskForCamera

        public boolean neverAskForCamera(android.support.v4.app.Fragment fragment)
        If true the user has checked the "Never ask again" option. We get this by checking two things. Whether we've asked before, checked with hasAskedForCameraPermission(), which returns false if the user has never seen the dialog. We also check whether we should request the permission rational for the system. If these two don't match up, the user has selected "Never ask again". Note: if we have the camera permission, and we call this method, it will return true. This is intentional as we don't want to ask for permissions once we have them. If you do that, you will loose the permission and dialog will come up again. Another note: if the user selected "Never ask again", then they give you permissions in the app settings page, and then remove them in the same page. This method will return true. Even though at that point you can ask for permissions. I have not been able to figure out a way around this.
        Parameters:
        fragment - asking for permission
        Returns:
        whether the user has checked "Never ask again" option

      • neverAskForCamera

        public boolean neverAskForCamera(android.app.Activity activity)
        If true the user has checked the "Never ask again" option. We get this by checking two things. Whether we've asked before, checked with hasAskedForCameraPermission(), which returns false if the user has never seen the dialog. We also check whether we should request the permission rational for the system. If these two don't match up, the user has selected "Never ask again". Note: if we have the camera permission, and we call this method, it will return true. This is intentional as we don't want to ask for permissions once we have them. If you do that, you will loose the permission and dialog will come up again. Another note: if the user selected "Never ask again", then they give you permissions in the app settings page, and then remove them in the same page. This method will return true. Even though at that point you can ask for permissions. I have not been able to figure out a way around this.
        Parameters:
        activity - asking for permission
        Returns:
        whether the user has checked "Never ask again" option
